courses.name: Topics in Theatre - Humanities/Fine Arts
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics. Subject and credit may vary from semester to semester. May be repeated with departmental consent.

courses.name: The Theatre in Society
courses.description: Examines the form and meaning of theatre in civilizations of the West from the ancient Greeks to modern times.

courses.name: Voice and Articulation
courses.description: Techniques for improving speaking voice; theories underlying techniques. Attention to student's articulation, pronunciation, voice quality, general expressiveness.

courses.name: World Theatre Workshop
courses.description: (same as BL_STU 1250). Provides a diverse ensemble of student performers, writers, and technicians with an intensive immersion in the process of theatrical production through the public presentation of dramatic literature that focuses on global issues of ethnicity and culture.

courses.name: Beginning Scenic Construction
courses.description: This course examines, through theory and practice, the art and science of technical theatre. Students explore the methods, equipment, and materials used in executing scenery, properties, and lighting designs for the stage, and participate in the backstage operation of a theatrical production.

courses.name: Beginning Costume Construction
courses.description: This course examines, through theory and practice, the art and science of costume technology in the theatre. Students explore the methods, equipment, and materials used in executing costume designs for the stage, and participate in the backstage operation of a theatrical production.

courses.name: Stage Makeup
courses.description: Character analysis, facial anatomy, color for stage and television makeup. Practice in application.

courses.name: Acting for Non-Majors
courses.description: Basic theory and practice of acting for the non theatre major.

courses.name: Stage Movement for the Actor
courses.description: Basic work in the techniques that comprise movement training for the actor.

courses.name: African-American Theatre History
courses.description: (same as BL_STU 1720). A historical and critical analysis of the evolution of African American cultural performance in the American theatre and entertainment industry.

courses.name: Topics in Theatre - Humanities
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics. Subject and credit may vary from semester to semester. May be repeated with department consent.

courses.name: African-American Cinema
courses.description: (same as BL_STU 2150). Study of the impact of cinema and the entertainment industry on the social perceptions of African-Americans and on African-American culture.

courses.name: Introduction to Performance Studies
courses.description: This course focuses on the writing of adaptations for the stage through performance.  Students develop skills in critical reading, writing, listening, speaking and analysis of performance as they study oral and literary texts, autobiography and narratives.

courses.name: Production Workshop I
courses.description: Work backstage in support of university theatre productions. Scenery, lighting, costumes, properties or other responsibilities. May be repeated. Graded on a S/U basis only.

courses.name: Stage Management
courses.description: Study of the role of the theatre stage manager. Practice in becoming effective in planning and stage managing theatre productions. Graded on A/F basis only.

courses.name: Stagecraft
courses.description: Fundamentals of properties and scenic construction stressing terminology and practical production experience.

courses.name: Performance Workshop
courses.description: Credit for performance in University Theatre Production. Must audition and be cast to receive credit. May be repeated. Graded on S/U basis only.

courses.name: Introduction to Theatre Design
courses.description: Design principles and elements as they relate to theatre performance. Use of drawing and creative 3-dimensional exercises to develop design concepts.
courses.recommendation: to students interested in directing, playwriting, and design for the theatre

courses.name: Introduction to Theatre History
courses.description: Survey of major periods emphasizing the produced play in its historical context.

courses.name: Principles of Script Analysis
courses.description: Methodologies of script analysis for theatrical purposes. Extensive writing will be required.

courses.name: Principles of Script Analysis - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Methodologies of script analysis for theatrical purposes. Extensive writing will be required.

courses.name: Script Analysis for Theatre Majors
courses.description: Advanced methodologies of script analysis. Critical analysis of scripts for theatre, film, and performance, including the analysis of plots, characters, themes, and language. Students in this class view performances and read scripts, then analyze the connections between the scripts and performances through extensive writing exercises.

courses.name: Beginning Playwriting
courses.description: (same as ENGLSH 2560). Study and practice of playwriting fundamentals; emphasizes the one-act play.

courses.name: Topics in Theatre - Humanities
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics. Subjects and earnable credit may vary from semester to semester. May be repeated with departmental consent.

courses.name: Topics in Theatre - Honors - Humanities
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics. Subjects and earnable credit may vary from semester to semester. May be repeated with departmental consent.

courses.name: Summer Repertory Theatre
courses.description: Participation in production of Summer Repertory Theatre. May be repeated.

courses.name: Performance of Literature
courses.description: (same as ENGLSH 3570 and COMMUN 3570). Analysis and oral interpretation of literary works. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Vocal Performance Technique
courses.description: This course develops the ability to use the voice as a creative and expressive instrument through a comprehensive study of speech and voice dynamics which include the exploration of proper breathing, relaxation, tonal placement, and non-regional articulation.

courses.name: Production Workshop II
courses.description: Credit earned in a technical project in support of a University Theatre production. Scenery, costumes, properties, or other responsibilities.  May be repeated to total of 3 hours.  Graded on S/U basis only.

courses.name: Costume Crafts
courses.description: To develop the skills and techniques needed in executing costume crafts, including millinery, corsetry, painting and dyeing, and embellishment.

courses.name: Theatrical Patternmaking
courses.description: Patternmaking for the theatre.  Basic knowledge of sewing required.

courses.name: Advanced Costume Construction
courses.description: Learn advanced techniques in theatrical costuming through lecture, demonstration and practical application.

courses.name: Scene Painting
courses.description: Studio practice in techniques of painting scenery for the Theatre.

courses.name: Acting I
courses.description: Basic theory, practice of acting, stage movement.

courses.name: Acting II
courses.description: Script analysis, character and role development in modern and contemporary non-realistic theatrical forms. Rehearsal and presentation of scenes, based on contemporary dramatic and performance theory.

courses.name: Computer Graphics in Theatre Design
courses.description: The use of graphics and CAD software to create theatre designs. The course will progress from 2D CAD drafting to 3D image rendering.

courses.name: Advanced Stage Makeup
courses.description: Advanced practical experience in stage makeup techniques. Projects might include: mask making, ventilation, advanced character applications. Practice in application. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Sound Design
courses.description: Beginning sound design for the theatre. Units include basics of researching, recording, and augmenting sound for the use in a theatrical production.

courses.name: Scene Design
courses.description: Theory/practice of scenic design for the theatre with emphasis on the evolutionary process of design from concept to reality.

courses.name: Theatrical Directing
courses.description: Theory and practice of play directing, script selection, casting, play analysis, rehearsal and performance.

courses.name: Theatrical Directing - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Theory and practice of play directing, script selection, casting, play analysis, rehearsal and performance.

courses.name: World Dramatic Literature
courses.description: (same as ENGLSH 3170). Survey of world drama from Greeks to present, focusing on structure, theory and performance.

courses.name: World Dramatic Literature - Writing Intensive
courses.description: (same as ENGLSH 3170). Survey of world drama from Greeks to present, focusing on structure, theory and performance.

courses.name: New American Theatre
courses.description: Survey of drama of the most recent decade as it documents contemporary mores and amplifies cultural themes.

courses.name: The Theatre Experience: From Page to Stage and Screen
courses.description: Stimulates critical thinking about theatrical performance, its relationship to the society of which it is a part, and its past and present significance as an art form, a cultural resource, a social institution, and a commercial enterprise.

courses.name: Intermediate Playwriting
courses.description: (same as ENGLSH 3560). Intermediate study of the writing process as applied to theatre, leading to the creation of a full-length play to be considered for production.

courses.name: Screenwriting for Television and Film
courses.description: (same as FILM_S 3930). Fundamentals of storytelling utilizing tools and structure used by television and film.

courses.name: Topics in Theatre - Humanities
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics. Topic and credit may vary semester to semester. May be repeated with department consent.

courses.name: Acting III
courses.description: (cross-leveled with THEATR 7220). Period acting styles. Special projects in interpretation, rehearsal, creation of roles.

courses.name: Theory and Practice of Theatre of the Oppressed
courses.description: (same as PEA_ST 4240). Theory and practice of Augusto Boal's liberatory interactive theatre process, including application of techniques of specific social issues.

courses.name: Digital Media and Performance
courses.description: (cross-leveled with THEATR 7280). This course introduces students to the history and practice of the combination of live actors and digital media within the context of theatre and performance. Students learn about developments in the history of this topic as well as significant individuals, groups of artists, and theorists who have contributed to the field. Theories of performance are utilized as a way to understand subjects such as the development of computers and the Internet, the impact of technology and social media on society, virtual reality, telematics, robotics, and video games. Students create their own performances that combine live performances with digital media elements, and learn basic approaches to using computer software that is employed in creating these types of performances.

courses.name: Musical Theatre Performance
courses.description: A practical study for the actor of theatrical songs through character analysis, lyric interpretation and movement. A performance course.

courses.name: Stage Lighting Design
courses.description: Theory and practice of lighting for theatre production.

courses.name: Theatrical Costume Design
courses.description: Basic practice in costume rendering using charcoal, crayon, ink, watercolor and other media. Costume history, both theatrical and general, will be surveyed. Basic problems of theatre design will be considered.

courses.name: Advanced Directing
courses.description: (cross-leveled with THEATR 7600). Advanced principles of theatrical directing; emphasizes stylistic variations. May be repeated once.

courses.name: Introduction to Dramaturgy
courses.description: The course focuses on the practice of dramaturgy and the various functions currently performed by the artist/scholar identified as "dramaturg" including research, dramatic criticism/interpretation, new play development, marketing and educational outreach, and textual adaptation.

courses.name: Studies in Theatre History
courses.description: Advanced survey of major periods, movements. Repeatable to a maximum of 6 hours with instructor's consent.

courses.name: American Musicals
courses.description: (same as MUS_H_LI 4376). Historical survey of the development of the 20th-Century American Musical in Theatre and Film.

courses.name: Theatre Architecture
courses.description: Examines the renovation of existing buildings into workable theatre spaces. Includes history of theatre architecture.

courses.name: Studies in Dramatic Theory
courses.description: Analysis of history, meaning and function of selected concepts of contemporary dramatic and performance theory.

courses.name: Studies in Dramatic Literature
courses.description: (cross-leveled with THEATR 7820). Advanced survey of major movements, periods, writers. Repeatable to a maximum of 6 hours with instructor's consent.

courses.name: Studies in Dramatic Literature - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Advanced survey of major movements, periods, writers. Repeatable to a maximum of 6 hours with instructor's consent.

courses.name: Studies in Dramatic Criticism
courses.description: Survey of methods of criticism of scripts and performances.

courses.name: Advanced Playwriting: Problems
courses.description: (same as ENGLSH 4560; cross-leveled with THEATR 7920 and ENGLSH 7560). Advanced study of the writing process as applied to theatre, including theory and practice of special playwriting problems and techniques.

courses.name: Advanced Playwriting: Problems - Writing Intensive
courses.description: (same as ENGLSH 4560; cross-leveled with THEATR 7920 and ENGLSH 7560). Advanced study of the writing process as applied to theatre, including theory and practice of special playwriting problems and techniques.

courses.name: Adaptation of Literature for the Stage
courses.description: (same as ENGLSH 4570; cross-leveled with THEATR 7930 and ENGLSH 7570). This upper-division course will explore adaptation principles and practices with a variety of forms of literature that were not originally written for the stage.

courses.name: Adaptation of Literature for Film
courses.description: (same as FILM_S 4935 and ENGLSH 4935; cross-leveled with THEATR 7935, ENGLSH 7580 and FILM_S 7935).  This upper-division course will explore adaptation principles and practices with a variety of forms for literature that were not originally written for film.

courses.name: Advanced Screenwriting: Styles
courses.description: (same as ENGLSH 4938; cross-leveled with THEATR 7938, ENGLSH 7938).  To develop advanced skills of screenwriting through a focus on a non-realistic, non-linear dramatic writing styles in development of a full-length screenplay. Areas of study will include techniques of magic realism, symbolism, expressionism, absurdism, surrealism/dada, mythic/fantasy, musicals, political docudrama, and science fiction.

courses.name: Internship in Theatre
courses.description: Internship: Experimental learning as an actor, designer, technician, publicist/manager, or dramaturg with an approved theatre company.  Graded on S/U basis only.

courses.name: Directed Readings in Theatre
courses.description: Independent reading, reports.

courses.name: Capstone in Theatre
courses.description: Theatre experiences and knowledge gained by students are connected through compilation of resume and portfolio. Student will meet with faculty jury to discuss his/her body of theatrical work. Required for senior theatre students.  Graded on S/U basis only.

courses.name: Topics
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics. Topic and credit may vary semester to semester. May be repeated with department consent.

courses.name: Acting III
courses.description: (cross-leveled with THEATR 7220). Period acting styles. Special projects in interpretation, rehearsal, creation of roles.

courses.name: Theory and Practice of Theatre of the Oppressed
courses.description: (same as PEA_ST 7240). Theory and practice of Augusto Boal's liberatory interactive theatre process, including application of techniques of specific social issues.

courses.name: Digital Media and Performance
courses.description: (cross-leveled with THEATR 4280).  This course introduces students to the history and practice of the combination of live actors and digital media within the context of theatre and performance. Students learn about developments in the history of this topic as well as significant individuals, groups of artists, and theorists who have contributed to the field. Theories of performance are utilized as a way to understand subjects such as the development of computers and the Internet, the impact of technology and social media on society, virtual reality, telematics, robotics, and video games. Students create their own performances that combine live performances with digital media elements, and learn basic approaches to using computer software that is employed in creating these types of performances.

courses.name: Stage Lighting Design
courses.description: Theory and practice of lighting for theatre production.

courses.name: Advanced Directing
courses.description: (cross-leveled with THEATR 4600). Advanced principles of theatrical directing; emphasizes stylistic variations. May be repeated once.

courses.name: Studies in Theatre History
courses.description: Advanced survey of major periods, movements. Repeatable to a maximum of 6 hours with instructor's consent.

courses.name: History of American Theatre I
courses.description: Examination of theatrical literature and production from the beginnings to World War One.

courses.name: History of the American Theatre II
courses.description: Examination of theatrical literature and production from World War One to the present.

courses.name: Theatre Architecture
courses.description: Examines the renovation of existing buildings into workable theatre spaces. Includes history of theatre architecture.

courses.name: Studies in Dramatic Theory
courses.description: Analysis of history, meaning and function of selected concepts of contemporary dramatic and performance theory.

courses.name: Studies in Dramatic Literature
courses.description: Advanced survey of major movements, periods, writers. Repeatable to a maximum of 6 hours with instructor's consent.

courses.name: Studies in Dramatic Criticism
courses.description: Survey of methods of criticism of scripts and performances.

courses.name: Advanced Playwriting: Problems
courses.description: (same as ENGLSH 7560; cross-leveled with THEATR 4920 and ENGLSH 4560). Advanced study of the writing process as applied to theatre, including theory and practice of special playwriting problems and techniques.

courses.name: Adaptation of Literature for the Stage
courses.description: (same as ENGLSH 7570; cross-leveled with THEATR 4930). Explores adaptation principles and practices with a variety of forms of literature that were not originally written for the stage.

courses.name: Adaptation of Literature for Film
courses.description: (same as ENGLSH 7580 and FILM_S 7935; cross-leveled with THEATR 4935, FILM_S 4935 and ENGLSH 4935).  This upper-division course will explore adaptation principles and practices with a variety of forms of literature that were not originally written for film.

courses.name: Advanced Screenwriting: Styles
courses.description: (same as ENGLSH 7938; cross-leveled with THEATR 4938, ENGLSH 4938).  To develop advanced skills of screenwriting through a focus on a non-realistic dramatic writing technique in the development of a full-length screenplay. Areas of study will include techniques of magic realism, symbolism, expressionism, absurdism, surrealism/dada, mythic/fantasy, musicals, political docudrama, and science fiction.

courses.name: Introduction to Dramaturgy
courses.description: This course focuses on the practice of dramaturgy and the various functions currently performed by the artist/scholar identified as "dramaturg" including research, dramatic criticism/interpretation, new play development, marketing and educational outreach, and textual adaptation. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Directed Readings in Theatre
courses.description: Independent reading, reports.

courses.name: Topics in Theatre
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics.  Topic and credit may vary from semester to semester.  May be repeated with department consent.

courses.name: Research in Theatre
courses.description: Independent research of advanced nature leading to report. Graded on S/U basis only.

courses.name: Theatre Scholarship
courses.description: History, goals, and techniques of academic writing in theatre including research, types of studies, primary materials, interpretation, writing techniques, and publication.

courses.name: Performance Ethnography
courses.description: This graduate seminar will explore intersections of the fields of ethnography and performance: both studies of ethnographic research conducted within a performance paradigm and the performance of ethnographic research. The class will explore major critical and theoretical issues about ethnography and performance, including the conflation and differences between the forms of ethnographic texts and traditional performance scripts, questions about what constitutes performance ethnography as a genre, the construction and deconstruction of identities and communities inherent in performance ethnography, strategies for creating and critiquing the performance of ethnographic research, ethical questions related to representation and the performance of ethnographic research, writing performance ethnography, and the staging of texts based on ethnographic research.

courses.name: Problems in Theatre
courses.description: Individual study/project not leading to thesis or dissertation.

courses.name: Backgrounds of Modern Theatre Practice
courses.description: Survey of modern performance theory, aesthetics and practice. Emphasis on European theatre since 1875. May be repeated or credit.

courses.name: Seminar in Theatre History
courses.description: Selected problems in theatre history. May be repeated.

courses.name: Graduate Seminar in Dramatic Literature
courses.description: This is a course that explores the influence of major playwrights and playwriting in society--specific playwrights and their works are determined by the course professor.

courses.name: Seminar in Dramatic Theory and Criticism
courses.description: Selected topics in dramatic theory and criticism. May be repeated.

courses.name: Directed Readings in Theatre
courses.description: Independent reading, reports.

courses.name: Graduate Seminar in Playwriting
courses.description: (same as ENGLSH 8560). Seminar in theory, practice, and pedagogy of playwriting, students prepare a mid-term in playwriting theory, a full-length play, a research paper, and a syllabus and lesson plans for an undergraduate playwriting course.

courses.name: Research in Theatre
courses.description: Research leading to thesis or dissertation. Graded on a S/U basis only.
